trans-unit.source: Analyze Twitter data with Hadoop in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Analyze Twitter data with Hadoop in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Hive to analyze Twitter data on Hadoop in HDInsight to find the usage frequency of a particular word.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Hive to analyze Twitter data on Hadoop in HDInsight to find the usage frequency of a particular word.

trans-unit.source: Analyze Twitter data using Hive in HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Analyze Twitter data using Hive in HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Social websites are one of the major driving forces for big-data adoption.
trans-unit.target: Social websites are one of the major driving forces for big-data adoption.

trans-unit.source: Public APIs provided
trans-unit.target: Public APIs provided

trans-unit.source: by sites like Twitter are a useful source of data for analyzing and understanding popular trends.
trans-unit.target: by sites like Twitter are a useful source of data for analyzing and understanding popular trends.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will get tweets by using a Twitter streaming API, and then use Apache Hive
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will get tweets by using a Twitter streaming API, and then use Apache Hive

trans-unit.source: on Azure HDInsight to get a list of Twitter users who sent the most tweets that contained a certain word.
trans-unit.target: on Azure HDInsight to get a list of Twitter users who sent the most tweets that contained a certain word.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The steps in this document require a Windows-based HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The steps in this document require a Windows-based HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For steps specific to a Linux-based cluster, see [Analyze Twitter data using Hive in HDInsight (Linux)](hdinsight-analyze-twitter-data-linux.md).
trans-unit.target: For steps specific to a Linux-based cluster, see [Analyze Twitter data using Hive in HDInsight (Linux)](hdinsight-analyze-twitter-data-linux.md).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] A similar sample is in the HDInsight Sample Gallery.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] A similar sample is in the HDInsight Sample Gallery.

trans-unit.source: Watch the Channel 9 video: Analyze Twitter trends using Apache Hive in HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Watch the Channel 9 video: Analyze Twitter trends using Apache Hive in HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: **A workstation** with Azure PowerShell installed and configured.
trans-unit.target: **A workstation** with Azure PowerShell installed and configured.

trans-unit.source: See [Install and use Azure PowerShell](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/install-and-use-azure-powershell/).
trans-unit.target: See [Install and use Azure PowerShell](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/install-and-use-azure-powershell/).

trans-unit.source: To execute Windows PowerShell scripts, you must run Azure PowerShell as administrator and set the execution policy to *RemoteSigned*.
trans-unit.target: To execute Windows PowerShell scripts, you must run Azure PowerShell as administrator and set the execution policy to *RemoteSigned*.

trans-unit.source: See [Run Windows PowerShell scripts][powershell-script].
trans-unit.target: See [Run Windows PowerShell scripts][powershell-script].

trans-unit.source: Before running Windows PowerShell scripts, make sure you are connected to your Azure subscription by using the following cmdlet:
trans-unit.target: Before running Windows PowerShell scripts, make sure you are connected to your Azure subscription by using the following cmdlet:

trans-unit.source: If you have multiple Azure subscriptions, use the following cmdlet to set the current subscription:
trans-unit.target: If you have multiple Azure subscriptions, use the following cmdlet to set the current subscription:

trans-unit.source: **An Azure HDInsight cluster**.
trans-unit.target: **An Azure HDInsight cluster**.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on cluster provisioning, see [Get started using HDInsight][hdinsight-get-started] or [Provision HDInsight clusters] [hdinsight-provision].
trans-unit.target: For instructions on cluster provisioning, see [Get started using HDInsight][hdinsight-get-started] or [Provision HDInsight clusters] [hdinsight-provision].

trans-unit.source: You will need the cluster name later in the tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You will need the cluster name later in the tutorial.

trans-unit.source: The following table lists the files used in this tutorial:
trans-unit.target: The following table lists the files used in this tutorial:

trans-unit.source: Files
trans-unit.target: Files

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: /tutorials/twitter/data/tweets.txt
trans-unit.target: /tutorials/twitter/data/tweets.txt

trans-unit.source: The source data for the Hive job.
trans-unit.target: The source data for the Hive job.

trans-unit.source: /tutorials/twitter/output
trans-unit.target: /tutorials/twitter/output

trans-unit.source: The output folder for the Hive job.
trans-unit.target: The output folder for the Hive job.

trans-unit.source: The default Hive job output file name is **000000_0**.
trans-unit.target: The default Hive job output file name is **000000_0**.

trans-unit.source: tutorials/twitter/twitter.hql
trans-unit.target: tutorials/twitter/twitter.hql

trans-unit.source: The HiveQL script file.
trans-unit.target: The HiveQL script file.

trans-unit.source: /tutorials/twitter/jobstatus
trans-unit.target: /tutorials/twitter/jobstatus

trans-unit.source: The Hadoop job status.
trans-unit.target: The Hadoop job status.

trans-unit.source: Get Twitter feed
trans-unit.target: Get Twitter feed

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will use the [Twitter streaming APIs][twitter-streaming-api].
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will use the [Twitter streaming APIs][twitter-streaming-api].

trans-unit.source: The specific Twitter streaming API you will use is [statuses/filter][twitter-statuses-filter].
trans-unit.target: The specific Twitter streaming API you will use is [statuses/filter][twitter-statuses-filter].

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] A file containing 10,000 tweets and the Hive script file (covered in the next section) have been uploaded in a public Blob container.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] A file containing 10,000 tweets and the Hive script file (covered in the next section) have been uploaded in a public Blob container.

trans-unit.source: You can skip this section if you want to use the uploaded files.
trans-unit.target: You can skip this section if you want to use the uploaded files.

trans-unit.source: [Tweets data](https://dev.twitter.com/docs/platform-objects/tweets) is stored in the JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) format that contains a complex nested structure.
trans-unit.target: [Tweets data](https://dev.twitter.com/docs/platform-objects/tweets) is stored in the JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) format that contains a complex nested structure.

trans-unit.source: Instead of writing many lines of code by using a conventional programming language, you can transform this nested structure into a Hive table, so that it can be queried by a Structured Query Language (SQL)-like language called HiveQL.
trans-unit.target: Instead of writing many lines of code by using a conventional programming language, you can transform this nested structure into a Hive table, so that it can be queried by a Structured Query Language (SQL)-like language called HiveQL.

trans-unit.source: Twitter uses OAuth to provide authorized access to its API.
trans-unit.target: Twitter uses OAuth to provide authorized access to its API.

trans-unit.source: OAuth is an authentication protocol that allows users to approve applications to act on their behalf without sharing their password.
trans-unit.target: OAuth is an authentication protocol that allows users to approve applications to act on their behalf without sharing their password.

trans-unit.source: More information can be found at [oauth.net](http://oauth.net/) or in the excellent [Beginner's Guide to OAuth](http://hueniverse.com/oauth/) from Hueniverse.
trans-unit.target: More information can be found at [oauth.net](http://oauth.net/) or in the excellent [Beginner's Guide to OAuth](http://hueniverse.com/oauth/) from Hueniverse.

trans-unit.source: The first step to use OAuth is to create a new application on the Twitter Developer site.
trans-unit.target: The first step to use OAuth is to create a new application on the Twitter Developer site.

trans-unit.source: **To create a Twitter application**
trans-unit.target: **To create a Twitter application**

trans-unit.source: Sign in to [https://apps.twitter.com/](https://apps.twitter.com/).
trans-unit.target: Sign in to [https://apps.twitter.com/](https://apps.twitter.com/).

trans-unit.source: Click the **Sign up now** link if you don't have a Twitter account.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Sign up now** link if you don't have a Twitter account.

trans-unit.source: Click **Create New App**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create New App**.

trans-unit.source: Enter **Name**, **Description**, **Website**.
trans-unit.target: Enter **Name**, **Description**, **Website**.

trans-unit.source: You can make up a URL for the **Website** field.
trans-unit.target: You can make up a URL for the **Website** field.

trans-unit.source: The following table shows some sample values to use:
trans-unit.target: The following table shows some sample values to use:

trans-unit.source: Field
trans-unit.target: Field

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: MyHDInsightApp
trans-unit.target: MyHDInsightApp

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: MyHDInsightApp
trans-unit.target: MyHDInsightApp

trans-unit.source: Website
trans-unit.target: Website

trans-unit.source: http://www.myhdinsightapp.com
trans-unit.target: http://www.myhdinsightapp.com

trans-unit.source: Check **Yes, I agree**, and then click **Create your Twitter application**.
trans-unit.target: Check **Yes, I agree**, and then click **Create your Twitter application**.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Permissions** tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Permissions** tab.

trans-unit.source: The default permission is **Read only**.
trans-unit.target: The default permission is **Read only**.

trans-unit.source: This is sufficient for this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: This is sufficient for this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Keys and Access Tokens** tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Keys and Access Tokens** tab.

trans-unit.source: Click **Create my access token**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create my access token**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Test OAuth** in the upper-right corner of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click **Test OAuth** in the upper-right corner of the page.

trans-unit.source: Write down **consumer key**, **Consumer secret**, **Access token**, and **Access token secret**.
trans-unit.target: Write down **consumer key**, **Consumer secret**, **Access token**, and **Access token secret**.

trans-unit.source: You will need the values later in the tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You will need the values later in the tutorial.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will use Windows PowerShell to make the web service call.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will use Windows PowerShell to make the web service call.

trans-unit.source: For a .NET C# sample, see [Analyze real-time Twitter sentiment with HBase in HDInsight][hdinsight-hbase-twitter-sentiment].
trans-unit.target: For a .NET C# sample, see [Analyze real-time Twitter sentiment with HBase in HDInsight][hdinsight-hbase-twitter-sentiment].

trans-unit.source: The other popular tool to make web service calls is [*Curl*][curl].
trans-unit.target: The other popular tool to make web service calls is [*Curl*][curl].

trans-unit.source: Curl can be downloaded from [here][curl-download].
trans-unit.target: Curl can be downloaded from [here][curl-download].

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] When you use the curl command in Windows, use double quotes instead of single quotes for the option values.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] When you use the curl command in Windows, use double quotes instead of single quotes for the option values.

trans-unit.source: **To get tweets**
trans-unit.target: **To get tweets**

trans-unit.source: Open the Windows PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE).
trans-unit.target: Open the Windows PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE).

trans-unit.source: (On the Windows 8 Start screen, type **PowerShell_ISE** and then click **Windows PowerShell ISE**.
trans-unit.target: (On the Windows 8 Start screen, type **PowerShell_ISE** and then click **Windows PowerShell ISE**.

trans-unit.source: See [Start Windows PowerShell on Windows 8 and Windows][powershell-start].)
trans-unit.target: See [Start Windows PowerShell on Windows 8 and Windows][powershell-start].)

trans-unit.source: Copy the following script into the script pane:
trans-unit.target: Copy the following script into the script pane:

trans-unit.source: Set the first five to eight variables in the script:
trans-unit.target: Set the first five to eight variables in the script:

trans-unit.source: Variable
trans-unit.target: Variable

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: $clusterName
trans-unit.target: $clusterName

trans-unit.source: This is the name of the HDInsight cluster where you want to run the application.
trans-unit.target: This is the name of the HDInsight cluster where you want to run the application.

trans-unit.source: $oauth_consumer_key
trans-unit.target: $oauth_consumer_key

trans-unit.source: This is the Twitter application **consumer key** you wrote down earlier when you created the Twitter application.
trans-unit.target: This is the Twitter application **consumer key** you wrote down earlier when you created the Twitter application.

trans-unit.source: $oauth_consumer_secret
trans-unit.target: $oauth_consumer_secret

trans-unit.source: This is the Twitter application **consumer secret** you wrote down earlier.
trans-unit.target: This is the Twitter application **consumer secret** you wrote down earlier.

trans-unit.source: $oauth_token
trans-unit.target: $oauth_token

trans-unit.source: This is the Twitter application **access token** you wrote down earlier.
trans-unit.target: This is the Twitter application **access token** you wrote down earlier.

trans-unit.source: $oauth_token_secret
trans-unit.target: $oauth_token_secret

trans-unit.source: This is the Twitter application **access token secret** you wrote down earlier.
trans-unit.target: This is the Twitter application **access token secret** you wrote down earlier.

trans-unit.source: $destBlobName
trans-unit.target: $destBlobName

trans-unit.source: This is the output blob name.
trans-unit.target: This is the output blob name.

trans-unit.source: The default value is **tutorials/twitter/data/tweets.txt**.
trans-unit.target: The default value is **tutorials/twitter/data/tweets.txt**.

trans-unit.source: If you change the default value, you will need to update the Windows PowerShell scripts accordingly.
trans-unit.target: If you change the default value, you will need to update the Windows PowerShell scripts accordingly.

trans-unit.source: $trackString
trans-unit.target: $trackString

trans-unit.source: The web service will return tweets related to these keywords.
trans-unit.target: The web service will return tweets related to these keywords.

trans-unit.source: The default value is **Azure, Cloud, HDInsight**.
trans-unit.target: The default value is **Azure, Cloud, HDInsight**.

trans-unit.source: If you change the default value, you will update the Windows PowerShell scripts accordingly.
trans-unit.target: If you change the default value, you will update the Windows PowerShell scripts accordingly.

trans-unit.source: $lineMax
trans-unit.target: $lineMax

trans-unit.source: The value determines how many tweets the script will read.
trans-unit.target: The value determines how many tweets the script will read.

trans-unit.source: It takes about three minutes to read 100 tweets.
trans-unit.target: It takes about three minutes to read 100 tweets.

trans-unit.source: You can set a larger number, but it will take more time to download.
trans-unit.target: You can set a larger number, but it will take more time to download.

trans-unit.source: Press **F5** to run the script.
trans-unit.target: Press **F5** to run the script.

trans-unit.source: If you run into problems, as a workaround, select all the lines, and then press **F8**.
trans-unit.target: If you run into problems, as a workaround, select all the lines, and then press **F8**.

trans-unit.source: You shall see "Complete!"
trans-unit.target: You shall see "Complete!"

trans-unit.source: at the end of the output.
trans-unit.target: at the end of the output.

trans-unit.source: Any error messages will be displayed in red.
trans-unit.target: Any error messages will be displayed in red.

trans-unit.source: As a validation procedure, you can check the output file, **/tutorials/twitter/data/tweets.txt**, on your Azure Blob storage by using an Azure storage explorer or Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: As a validation procedure, you can check the output file, **/tutorials/twitter/data/tweets.txt**, on your Azure Blob storage by using an Azure storage explorer or Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: For a sample Windows PowerShell script for listing files, see [Use Blob storage with HDInsight][hdinsight-storage-powershell].
trans-unit.target: For a sample Windows PowerShell script for listing files, see [Use Blob storage with HDInsight][hdinsight-storage-powershell].

trans-unit.source: Create HiveQL script
trans-unit.target: Create HiveQL script

trans-unit.source: Using Azure PowerShell, you can run multiple HiveQL statements one at a time, or package the HiveQL statement into a script file.
trans-unit.target: Using Azure PowerShell, you can run multiple HiveQL statements one at a time, or package the HiveQL statement into a script file.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will create a HiveQL script.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will create a HiveQL script.

trans-unit.source: The script file must be uploaded to Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: The script file must be uploaded to Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: In the next section, you will run the script file by using Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: In the next section, you will run the script file by using Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The Hive script file and a file containing 10,000 tweets have been uploaded in a public Blob container.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The Hive script file and a file containing 10,000 tweets have been uploaded in a public Blob container.

trans-unit.source: You can skip this section if you want to use the uploaded files.
trans-unit.target: You can skip this section if you want to use the uploaded files.

trans-unit.source: The HiveQL script will perform the following:
trans-unit.target: The HiveQL script will perform the following:

trans-unit.source: **Drop the tweets_raw table** in case the table already exists.
trans-unit.target: **Drop the tweets_raw table** in case the table already exists.

trans-unit.source: **Create the tweets_raw Hive table**.
trans-unit.target: **Create the tweets_raw Hive table**.

trans-unit.source: This temporary Hive structured table holds the data for further extract, transform, and load (ETL) processing.
trans-unit.target: This temporary Hive structured table holds the data for further extract, transform, and load (ETL) processing.

trans-unit.source: For information on partitions, see [Hive tutorial][apache-hive-tutorial].
trans-unit.target: For information on partitions, see [Hive tutorial][apache-hive-tutorial].

trans-unit.source: **Load data** from the source folder, /tutorials/twitter/data.
trans-unit.target: **Load data** from the source folder, /tutorials/twitter/data.

trans-unit.source: The large tweets dataset in nested JSON format has now been transformed into a temporary Hive table structure.
trans-unit.target: The large tweets dataset in nested JSON format has now been transformed into a temporary Hive table structure.

trans-unit.source: **Drop the tweets table** in case the table already exists.
trans-unit.target: **Drop the tweets table** in case the table already exists.

trans-unit.source: **Create the tweets table**.
trans-unit.target: **Create the tweets table**.

trans-unit.source: Before you can query against the tweets dataset by using Hive, you need to run another ETL process.
trans-unit.target: Before you can query against the tweets dataset by using Hive, you need to run another ETL process.

trans-unit.source: This ETL process defines a more detailed table schema for the data that you have stored in the "twitter_raw" table.
trans-unit.target: This ETL process defines a more detailed table schema for the data that you have stored in the "twitter_raw" table.

trans-unit.source: **Insert overwrite table**.
trans-unit.target: **Insert overwrite table**.

trans-unit.source: This complex Hive script will kick off a set of long MapReduce jobs by the Hadoop cluster.
trans-unit.target: This complex Hive script will kick off a set of long MapReduce jobs by the Hadoop cluster.

trans-unit.source: Depending on your dataset and the size of your cluster, this could take about 10 minutes.
trans-unit.target: Depending on your dataset and the size of your cluster, this could take about 10 minutes.

trans-unit.source: **Insert overwrite directory**.
trans-unit.target: **Insert overwrite directory**.

trans-unit.source: Run a query and output the dataset to a file.
trans-unit.target: Run a query and output the dataset to a file.

trans-unit.source: This query will return a list of Twitter users who sent most tweets that contained the word "Azure".
trans-unit.target: This query will return a list of Twitter users who sent most tweets that contained the word "Azure".

trans-unit.source: **To create a Hive script and upload it to Azure**
trans-unit.target: **To create a Hive script and upload it to Azure**

trans-unit.source: Open Windows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: Open Windows PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: Copy the following script into the script pane:
trans-unit.target: Copy the following script into the script pane:

trans-unit.source: Set the first two variables in the script:
trans-unit.target: Set the first two variables in the script:

trans-unit.source: Variable
trans-unit.target: Variable

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: $clusterName
trans-unit.target: $clusterName

trans-unit.source: Enter the HDInsight cluster name where you want to run the application.
trans-unit.target: Enter the HDInsight cluster name where you want to run the application.

trans-unit.source: $subscriptionID
trans-unit.target: $subscriptionID

trans-unit.source: Enter your Azure subscription ID.
trans-unit.target: Enter your Azure subscription ID.

trans-unit.source: $sourceDataPath
trans-unit.target: $sourceDataPath

trans-unit.source: The Azure Blob storage location where the Hive queries will read the data from.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Blob storage location where the Hive queries will read the data from.

trans-unit.source: You don't need to change this variable.
trans-unit.target: You don't need to change this variable.

trans-unit.source: $outputPath
trans-unit.target: $outputPath

trans-unit.source: The Azure Blob storage location where the Hive queries will output the results.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Blob storage location where the Hive queries will output the results.

trans-unit.source: You don't need to change this variable.
trans-unit.target: You don't need to change this variable.

trans-unit.source: $hqlScriptFile
trans-unit.target: $hqlScriptFile

trans-unit.source: The location and the file name of the HiveQL script file.
trans-unit.target: The location and the file name of the HiveQL script file.

trans-unit.source: You don't need to change this variable.
trans-unit.target: You don't need to change this variable.

trans-unit.source: Press **F5** to run the script.
trans-unit.target: Press **F5** to run the script.

trans-unit.source: If you run into problems, as a workaround, select all the lines, and then press **F8**.
trans-unit.target: If you run into problems, as a workaround, select all the lines, and then press **F8**.

trans-unit.source: You shall see "Complete!"
trans-unit.target: You shall see "Complete!"

trans-unit.source: at the end of the output.
trans-unit.target: at the end of the output.

trans-unit.source: Any error messages will be displayed in red.
trans-unit.target: Any error messages will be displayed in red.

trans-unit.source: As a validation procedure, you can check the output file, **/tutorials/twitter/twitter.hql**, on your Azure Blob storage by using an Azure storage explorer or Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: As a validation procedure, you can check the output file, **/tutorials/twitter/twitter.hql**, on your Azure Blob storage by using an Azure storage explorer or Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: For a sample Windows PowerShell script for listing files, see [Use Blob storage with HDInsight][hdinsight-storage-powershell].
trans-unit.target: For a sample Windows PowerShell script for listing files, see [Use Blob storage with HDInsight][hdinsight-storage-powershell].

trans-unit.source: Process Twitter data by using Hive
trans-unit.target: Process Twitter data by using Hive

trans-unit.source: You have finished all the preparation work.
trans-unit.target: You have finished all the preparation work.

trans-unit.source: Now, you can invoke the Hive script and check the results.
trans-unit.target: Now, you can invoke the Hive script and check the results.

trans-unit.source: Submit a Hive job
trans-unit.target: Submit a Hive job

trans-unit.source: Use the following Windows PowerShell script to run the Hive script.
trans-unit.target: Use the following Windows PowerShell script to run the Hive script.

trans-unit.source: You will need to set the first variable.
trans-unit.target: You will need to set the first variable.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] To use the tweets and the HiveQL script you uploaded in the last two sections, set $hqlScriptFile to "/tutorials/twitter/twitter.hql".
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] To use the tweets and the HiveQL script you uploaded in the last two sections, set $hqlScriptFile to "/tutorials/twitter/twitter.hql".

trans-unit.source: To use the ones that have been uploaded to a public blob for you, set $hqlScriptFile to "wasb://twittertrend@hditutorialdata.blob.core.windows.net/twitter.hql".
trans-unit.target: To use the ones that have been uploaded to a public blob for you, set $hqlScriptFile to "wasb://twittertrend@hditutorialdata.blob.core.windows.net/twitter.hql".

trans-unit.source: Check the results
trans-unit.target: Check the results

trans-unit.source: Use the following Windows PowerShell script to check the Hive job output.
trans-unit.target: Use the following Windows PowerShell script to check the Hive job output.

trans-unit.source: You will need to set the first two variables.
trans-unit.target: You will need to set the first two variables.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The Hive table uses \001 as the field delimiter.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The Hive table uses \001 as the field delimiter.

trans-unit.source: The delimiter is not visible in the output.
trans-unit.target: The delimiter is not visible in the output.

trans-unit.source: After the analysis results have been placed in Azure Blob storage, you can export the data to an Azure SQL database/SQL server, export the data to Excel by using Power Query, or connect your application to the data by using the Hive ODBC Driver.
trans-unit.target: After the analysis results have been placed in Azure Blob storage, you can export the data to an Azure SQL database/SQL server, export the data to Excel by using Power Query, or connect your application to the data by using the Hive ODBC Driver.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Use Sqoop with HDInsight][hdinsight-use-sqoop], [Analyze flight delay data using HDInsight][hdinsight-analyze-flight-delay-data], [Connect Excel to HDInsight with Power Query][hdinsight-power-query], and [Connect Excel to HDInsight with the Microsoft Hive ODBC Driver][hdinsight-hive-odbc].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Use Sqoop with HDInsight][hdinsight-use-sqoop], [Analyze flight delay data using HDInsight][hdinsight-analyze-flight-delay-data], [Connect Excel to HDInsight with Power Query][hdinsight-power-query], and [Connect Excel to HDInsight with the Microsoft Hive ODBC Driver][hdinsight-hive-odbc].

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial we have seen how to transform an unstructured JSON dataset into a structured Hive table to query, explore, and analyze data from Twitter by using HDInsight on Azure.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial we have seen how to transform an unstructured JSON dataset into a structured Hive table to query, explore, and analyze data from Twitter by using HDInsight on Azure.

trans-unit.source: To learn more, see:
